name: STATA/LaTex
tagline: templates to make STATA and LaTex play nice and look good
body:
#Features/Goals
## Good Looking
STATA's defaults are often ... less than beautiful
## Ready-to-use LaTeX text with commands/files generated from within STATA
Because lazy is better, and spending time on writing and re-writing LaTeX feels wasteful 

#Templates 
Summary Statistics, Regressions, Displaying Code
![](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16052646/11664690/38714e68-9db1-11e5-8a20-083e74babfa1.PNG)
![](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16052646/11664694/39459fec-9db1-11e5-8b50-8996a30f7ca1.PNG)
![](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16052646/11664696/3a3247fc-9db1-11e5-920f-b612e4d145b2.PNG)


Graphs: Categorical Plots, Maps
![map_example](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16052646/11664567/95b46264-9db0-11e5-8880-878fe549ed06.png)
![scatter example](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16052646/11664568/96fbc626-9db0-11e5-9d52-a3da057bdaa9.png)

#Files
## STATA_to_LaTex (.do)
Requires user-created commands

catplot

    Nicholas J. Cox

    Durham University

    n.j.cox@durham.ac.uk


estout

    Ben Jann

    Institute of Sociology

    University of Bern

    jann@soz.unibe.ch


spmap

    Maurizio Pisati

    Department of Sociology and Social Research

    University of Milano Bicocca - Italy

    maurizio.pisati@unimib.it


graph2tex

     Statistical Consulting Group

     Institute for Digital Research and Education, UCLA

     idrestat@ucla.edu 


## LaTex_from_STATA (.tex)
See the [template](https://www.sharelatex.com/project/5665e38ceb6f2bde13b7a6b0) on ShareLaTeX

~Tyler Mangin
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
